The PCM is responsible for the component project tasks regarding time/quality/cost. The PCM reports the progress of the component project, especially in case of deviations of the targets to PjM and TPM. The PCM involves expert teams as nedded PCM supports PjM/TPM in customer meetings if necessary.

About Video Project:

The camera based driver assistance system helps the driver by recognizing their surroundings quickly and reliably, then by processing information with remarkable speed and responding to the situation in safe & comfortable manner. Overall, they help to improve the safety by mitigating the potential accidents through predictive sensing of dangerous situations and also sharing the critical Information to the driver to improve the driving experience

1. A software architect needs to interact with customer, product managers, and developers in order to envision, model and provide initial models and designs that can be built. This role also may cover the meeting potential or current customers.
  2. A software architect has to constantly review the code to ensure the quality of the design by avoiding complexity, advocating clarity and to do this with the team. This usually requires hands-on work in terms of developing prototypes, contributing code or evaluating technologies.
  3. The role of a software architect includes collaborative working with a degree of humility and providing mentoring as required. Such collaboration also allows the architect to become familiar with the skills and interests in the team and to share their knowledge with the rest of the team. Humility is required to ensure that all the team is listened to, as they may have more specific experience or knowledge for the problem at hand.
  4. A software architect is a guiding star that shows to the business which technologies it should be using and what new technologies it should be considering, and why.

Modern vehicles have a diagnostic interface for off-board diagnostics, which makes it possible to connect a computer (client) or diagnostics tool, which is referred to as tester, to the bus system of the vehicle. Thus, the messages defined in UDS can be sent to the controllers which must provide the predetermined UDS services. This makes it possible to interrogate the fault memory of the individual control units in the vehicle or to update them with a new firmware.

Diagnostics Communication Protocol Module developer role deals with SW development which fits the context mentioned above along with detailed SW development activities mentioned below.

•Follow company development and quality processes
•Investigate for the issues or problem during the project development and after production.

Modern vehicles have a diagnostic interface for off-board diagnostics, which makes it possible to connect a computer (client) or diagnostics tool, which is referred to as tester, to the bus system of the vehicle. Thus, the messages defined in UDS can be sent to the controllers which must provide the predetermined UDS services. This makes it possible to interrogate the fault memory of the individual control units in the vehicle or to update them with a new firmware.

Diagnostics Communication Protocol Module developer role deals with SW development which fits the context mentioned above along with detailed SW development activities mentioned below.

•Follow company development and quality processes
•Investigate for the issues or problem during the project development and after production.
•Department task support / coordination

SAP DBM Sales Job Description

About the Job

The Consultant – Automotive SAP VMS/DBM needs to understand and can implement the best Business Processes in a SAP environment by designing appropriate solutions, supporting the customers’ business processes as part of the overall SAP programme. The Consultant – Automotive (SAP) will be responsible for the global solution which includes responsibility for the method and processes used to translate business requirements into a coherent solution considering balancing both the functional needs and data architecture. The candidate will provide an expert level of skills & knowledge in the evaluation, development, testing and delivery of automotive application and business process developments.

The primary solution focus area of the job is SAP Automotive – Vehicles/Units sales which would require knowledge & experience of SAP IS Automotive (SAP Vehicle Management system and SAP Dealer business management) and SAP Sales & distribution.

Skills and experience

Candidates with less experience will be considered for suitable positions.

·       The candidate should be well versed with SAP Vehicle Management system and SAP Dealer business management. The knowledge of SAP Sales & distribution and SAP Material management is preferred.

·       Excellent process and solution knowledge required in Vehicle Sales and Procurement areas.

·       Should have hands on experience on DBM Order Engine, Events and VMS action matrix Configuration

·       SAP certification will be a plus

·       Knowledge of SAP Solution Manager will be highly regarded.

About RBEI/NE-EM

NE-EM Product Engineering Services for Multi-Markets

NE-EM positions itself as “The” Product Engineering Partner for Multi Market engagements, consistently delivering cost effective and innovative solutions across the core Bosch non-mobility areas AA, DC, BSH, PT, BT & TT and Global Customers.

NE-EM has an impressive number of highly skilled & technically competent engineers providing expertise in the area of Product and sub system development, embedded platform development, application software development, Validations, analysis and simulation, Benchmarking, Prototyping, Certification and Industrialization, Content Development (AA, AR/VR) etc.
On the engineering excellence aspects, the leadership team focuses on creating an eco-system for delivering high quality across projects. NE-EM leverages on a strong PMO and the QA, who bring in Contemporary Engineering & Management process &practices and conformance across projects.

As a future centric organization, NE-EM has created a learning organization and immersed in developing solutions in involving Robotics, HMI, Video and Speech Recognition, Deep Learning, Block Chain and connecting products using wide connectivity options like 5G, BLE, LoRa, NB-IoT etc.

The Product Engineering CoE established, develops and nurtures Cross functional skills to deliver product programs with Quality, repeatability and faster time to market while improving processes, productivity and cost of ownership for our GB partners.

NE-EM engages with various GBs in the Bosch world. Namely:

• Automotive Aftermarket (BBM)
• Drives & Controls (BBI)
• Bosch Home appliances (BBG)
• Power Tools (BBG)
• Building Technology (BBE)
• Themo Technology (BBE)

Over the years, NE-EM has partnered with GBs to create world class products such as
• Mykie
• PAI
• NERO
• BT Local for Local range of products for Indian market
• Etc.

Cloud Solutions Architect

As a Senior Cloud Consultant, you will engage with clients to develop leading-edge cloud computing technology solutions based on best practices in product engineering and digital transformation adopting cloud, virtualization and new-age platform technologies.


Qualifications
 

  • Overall 15 years of experience with 5+ years hand-on experience on Cloud platforms - AWS/Azure/GCP

  • Minimum 2 years of experience in consulting large cloud transformation programs - especially in product modernization on cloud.

  • 10 + years of hands-on design, implementation, or consulting experience with large scale distributed systems.

  • Knowledge about APIs, Enterprise integration and Multi cloud strategy for products, and cloud native architecture.

  • Good understanding of Fullstack development and hands on experience in one such technology stack.

  • Strong communication skills to effectively communicate, make strategic recommendations to Sr. Mgmt as well as all levels of internal/external service partners

SW-PL act as a sub project leader in the SW development of an OEM project (Automotive Steering product)

The main activities of the SW Project Leader (SW-PL) are:

  • Development and implementation of defined technical content acc. to project targets (ASPICE/ISO26262/BSW/Modelbased)
  • Risk management within discipline scope and support of SYSPL/PjM
  • Project planning and tracking within discipline scope, cross-functional aligned between the disciplines
  • Evaluation and planning of technical requirements and estimation of effort within project scope
  • Consulting OEM on technical discussions within project scope
  • Preparation of releases within the project scope (e.g. Level x, QGCx)

Responsibilities

  • Implementation of the technical requirements in the project acc. to specification, plan, defined processes and regulations within discipline

Rights

  • Take design and implementation decisions to fulfil the technical requirements in the project within the defined boundaries
  • Accept / reject technical requirements in the customer project

Job Description:

You will be responsible for integrating software components from various contributors – internal and external to create working subsystems for high compute platforms for Automated Driving. Your key tasks include the following

·       Compile, Package, Verify, Quality Scan, Publish Artifact, Deploy to Development, Integration and Functional Testing

·       You will be responsible for KPIs including code quality metrics and release process in discussion with architects and process leads

·       Design, develop and maintain Integration tests, Performance tests and regression tests for components and system

·       Onboard tools from various stages of SW development on to a continuous software delivery pipeline

·       Design, develop and maintain build and integration environment, build system infrastructure and automated test suites

·       Act as first line of defense by troubleshooting build failures, failed test cases, crashes, faults and performance bottlenecks. Debug, analyze and forward bug reports to component responsibles with appropriate additional information like stack traces and logs

 

Experiences, competences and core strengths

Must-have

·       Hands on experience in developing software for microprocessor based embedded systems like infotainment, consumer electronics, smartphones, industrial embedded systems or avionics

·       Comprehensive knowledge on phases of Software development life cycle.

·       Experience in designing continuous integration pipeline stages including configuration management, build, branching strategy and build automation

·       Hands-on development experience in embedded systems using Linux, QNX, FreeRTOS or similar and be well versed with compiler toolchain and build systems. You should be well versed with C and C++programming languages

·       Knowledge of Operating systems Linux and/or QNX (boot process, memory layout)

·       Hands-on scripting experience with Python, Groovy, Shell, CAPL & Perl

·       Knowledge of state of the art in DevOps including popular tools

·       Functional knowledge of Intel Arch64 and ARM microprocessor architectures. Knowledge of coprocessors and hardware accelerators are also desirable. You should have experience in board bring up and flashing of microprocessor boards

·       You should have sufficient knowhow and experience on test frameworks, testing environments and test automation frameworks

You should be comfortable with SW architecture practices as well as working with architecture documentation tools like Enterprise Architect or Rhapsody

Good to have

·       Automotive system knowledge ECU, Sensors and systems will be great

·       Experience or awareness of Adaptive Autosar standard and platform

·       Good knowledge of ASPICE process standard is an added advantage

·       Knowledge of Functional Safety standards and processes like ISO26262 and ASIL

Optional

·       It would be great if you have experience in setting up DevOps pipeline components on either on-premise clusters or on any cloud infrastructure

Core strengths

·       Excellent communication and soft skills.

·       Very good at teamwork and problem solving

·       Ability to gel well with Agile teams in real spirit (culture & mindset)

·       Effective collaboration with global software engineering teams

·       Passion to learn new technologies beyond current experience

 

Skillset

1. SW Architecture tools

Enterprise Architect, Rhapsody or equivalent

2. Testing tools and environments

Vector tools and environments like CAPL and CANOE

Test tools like Robot Test Framework

3. DevOps pipeline components

·  Azure DevOps, Jenkins

·  Package management systems like Conan or Artifactory and packaging systems like Debian Packaging, npm or Docker trusted registry

4. Build Environment and tools

·  Build environments like Eclipse CDT or Visual Studio

·  Meta make systems like CMake, Catkin, Bit Bake, OBS etc.

·  Well versed with one or more compiler toolchains like GCC, Clang or QNX toolchain

·  Well versed with MAKE systems like GNU MAKE

·  Good experience in using virtualization environments like Docker, VirtualBox, QEMU, vmware etc.

·  Experience using flashing tools, measurement recording and replay tools

5. Embedded operating systems

·  Knowledge of interfaces and internals of any embedded, embeddable, RTOS like QNX, Linux, Windows Embedded, FreeRTOS or anything similar.

·  Well versed with POSIX APIs

6. Host Operating systems

In depth working experience on and internal knowledge of UNIX-like host operating systems (e.g. Linux, MacOS or Solaris) or Windows

7. Building embedded Linux systems

Experience in building customized Linux distributions using Yocto, OBS or similar

8. Development environments and tools

·  Expertise with popular IDEs like Visual Studio, Eclipse or similar

·  Hands on experience with symbolic debugging with gdb, Visual Studio or Trace32

·  Comfortable in using hardware or or-chip debug interfaces like JTAG, Lauterbach etc.

·  Extensive experience with profiling tools like perf, top, kcachegrind, valgrind etc. or QNX Momentix or any other profiling systems and tools

9. Programming languages

Development experience or proficiency in any high-level programming language:

·  Modern C++ (>11) and C

·  Java, Javascript, C# optionally

10. Scripting languages

Hands on development experience in scripting languages like Shell scripting, Python, Groovy

11. Markup languages for documentation

Knowledge of languages like JSON, XML or YAML

Bosch is at the forefront of innovation in the connected world and is impacting millions of lives every day through its products in mobility, industrial technology, consumer goods and energy and smart building sectors. We rely on data for every aspect of our product lifecycle and operations and we collect a lot of it every day. Our team is responsible for enabling a wide variety of Bosch product teams to make use of advancements in AI through centralized services that involve streaming data from connected services to building and deploying state-of-art AI solutions. You will be part of a global team to make this happen!

 

We are looking for a talented professional who is passionate about building fault-tolerant data services, analytics tools and AI solutions targeted towards cutting-edge applications. Your work will be used by hundreds of Bosch engineers and will have global impact by improving the quality and value of Bosch products.

 

Technical Skills:

  • Experience in creating statistical models and/or optimization frameworks for improving processes/products/profits

  • Strong interpersonal and communication skills: ability to tell a clear, concise, actionable story with data, to folks across various levels of the company.
  • Technical directions to junior in team, like to sort the respective task for responsible team members, mentoring them technically etc.

Job Description

Bosch is at the forefront of innovation in the connected world and is impacting millions of lives every day through its products in mobility, industrial technology, consumer goods and energy and smart building sectors. We rely on data for every aspect of our product lifecycle and operations and we collect a lot of it every day. Our team is responsible for enabling a wide variety of Bosch product teams to make use of advancements in AI through centralized services that involve streaming data from connected services to building and deploying state-of-art AI solutions. You will be part of a global team to make this happen!

We are looking for a talented professional who is passionate about building fault-tolerant data services and analytics tools targeted towards cutting-edge applications. Your work will be used by hundreds of Bosch engineers and will have global impact by improving the quality and value of Bosch products.

 

Requirement:

  • Hands-on experience with building Python/Java/Scala based data pipelines. Advanced knowledge of at least one programming language and should be willing to learn more. Experience with developing Airflow jobs would be a plus.
  • Hands-on experience with building batch and streaming data pipelines using distributed systems like Hadoop, Hive, Spark, Kafka, Sqoop, etc.
  • Hands-on experience with SQL, NoSQL and Document based data storage systems like Oracle, MySQL, Postgres, Teradata, MongoDB, Cassandra, Elasticsearch, Solr, etc.
  • Should have the experience and ability to understand customer data in depth and make best possible choices with respect to data structures, storage, file format, processing stack, etc.
  • Experience with designing and building robust, highly scalable and highly available data pipelines.
  • Experience with setting up and maintaining CI/CD pipeline for data integration jobs using Jenkins will be a plus.
  • Experience with building or migrating data pipelines to cloud (AWS/Azure) infrastructure will be a plus.
  • Experience building data pipelines using Azure Data Factory, Containers, Databricks, Synapse DB, AKS, Azure DevOps.
  • Azure Solutions Architect certification would be highly valuable.

 

Responsibilities:

  • Design, build and maintain efficient, reusable, reliable and scalable code and automation for Machine Learning Infrastructure on Azure Cloud as well as on on-perm infrastructure.
  • You would be working on developing and maintaining robust data extraction/ingestion frameworks, feature extraction pipelines and storage solutions.
  • Build and maintain CI/CD pipeline for code being developed and constantly work towards improving the release pipeline.
  • Actively participate in design and code reviews.
  • Identify bottlenecks and bugs in design and code and device solutions to ensure the best possible performance, quality and responsiveness of the pipelines being developed.
  • Collaborate with global and cross-functional teams to build, improve and maintain the best AI and ML platform for BOSCH.
  • Take accountability and ownership of Data Engineering and Platform Engineering projects and become the subject matter expert of end-to-end process.
  • Constantly research and be cognizant of latest emerging technologies in Data Engineering and Machine Learning.

Responsibility:

Taking into account the requirements of the steering system and the functional architecture of the Steering Control Unit, you will define and describe the technical as well as safety requirements of the ECU, taking into account costs, deadlines and Bosch quality requirements. During implementation, you will take into account the approach and methods of other Bosch divisions

You will be responsible for the technical analyses of the hardware safety concepts, linking them to the requirements of the platform projects and representing their results to best support the product development.

You coordinate the safety-relevant technical interfaces between different internal and external areas. In particular, you take into account the higher-level requirements of the Steering Control Unit, from which the ECU requirements and architecture are derived

In the context of development and product optimization, you evaluate the influences of the requirements in a structured manner as well as analyze the hardware system architecture and hardware implementation with regard to functional safety and develop optimization proposals.

You will work across divisions in the international development network and support the respective locations in the definition and integration of the respective product architecture.

MS/ESF1 – BEG - Functional Safety (FuSa) Engineering & Functional SafetySoftware Group (Multi Domain: Combustion, Hybrid, TCU, XCU, VCU, EV, INV, DC-DC, BMS, DaSY, ADAS, Steering)

 

The team is involved in developing safety concepts, Deriving Functional and Technical Safety Requirements, Safety Analysis, implementation and testing of safety hardware, software requirements according to ISO26262, an automotive safety standard defined for E/E systems.

 

With the trend of increasing technological complexity, software content and mechatronic implementation, there are increasing risks from systematic failures and random hardware failures. ISO 26262 includes guidance to avoid these risks by providing appropriate requirements and processes.

Software development for Automotive Powertrain domain in the area of ECU Diagnostics and Functional Safety (ISO26262)

The projects involve current and future technologies of Powertrain control (eg. Electrification, Fuel Cell, etc.)

 

Mandatory Experience and skills:

·       3 to 5 years experience in Embedded software development

·       Working experience on ISO26262 Functional safety topic.

·       Work experience on OBD and UDS Diagnostic service

.        Good programming and debugging skills

··       Experience in SW development Lifecycle like ASPICE

·       Good knowledge in scripting for test automation (Python/Perl/Java)

·       Team player and excellent communicator

·       Ability to work independently and as a part of a team

·       Attentive to details and self-motivated

Job Description

  • Responsible for functional safety development and the respective tests during the development of safety software in order to meet the requirement of corresponding standards such as ISO26262 efficiently.
  • Be involved in SDLC phases of a safety concept development in a real time embedded system. Support and evaluate functional safety requirements from premium car           manufacturers/project teams.
  • Responsible for the overall monitoring software concept for the project.
  • Coordinate the functional safety activities for the software for customer projects.
  • Supporting Functional Safety discussion in customer projects .
  • Support in performing complex functional safety related analysis e.g. FMEA, FMEDA, FTA, Freedom from Interference (FFI) etc
  • Representing functional safety interests inside the company, establish the safety culture.
  • RDCT for all the safety components implementation.

• Experience in programming Embedded C++ applications with strong background in C++ inheritance, templates and pointers.
  • Design methodology using OOAD & UML
  • Strong development experience in embedded C and RTOS
  • Should have detailed knowledge on microcontrollers / microprocessors
  • Embedded Linux OS concepts such as boot process, filesystems, kernel driver interfaces etc.
  • Basic knowledge on Low-level drivers for Linux.
  • Experience in working with Board Support Packages, using build systems based on CMAKE / YOCTO.
  • Experience in configuration management & defect tracking tools (Git / JIRA)
  • Experience in scripting languages like Shell, Make etc.,
  • Familiarity with popular Open Source libraries such as Boost, OpenSSL, MQTT etc.
  • Strong in OS concepts like efficient multi-threading and resource-sharing.
  • Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
  • Must be a self-starter.

We are looking for security engineer who love solving interesting problems and think “secure” is just a matter of perspective. The embedded pentester is responsible for performing high end security evaluation focusing on embedded devices used in various domains such as IoT, home automation, automobiles. As a senior member he/she is expected to serve as a technical leader in this area within organization.

 

Job Responsibilities include

·       Hardware hacking, and black-box style testing against embedded systems.

·       Investigate hardware and analyse them for points of access and vulnerabilities

·       Understand various chip packages and have a good understanding of fabrication of complex PCBs

·       Communicate complex vulnerability results to technical and non-technical audience.

·       Perform research and contribute to open source community on new attack methodology, vulnerability findings.

·       Train and help the team in acquire hardware hacking skills

·       Carryout the duties of laboratory assistant and be responsible for the upkeep and maintenance of inventory of Hardware and software assets of the laboratory.

·       Reverse engineering, hardware hacking, and black-box style testing against embedded systems.

·       Carry out Static and Dynamic Security code analysis.

·       Investigate possible logical attack scenarios by interpreting code review findings, and analyzing test results.

·       Carry out Binary Code analysis and fuzzing.

·       Create innovative attacks tools/automations for project specific needs.

·       Perform research and contribute to open source community on new attack methodology, vulnerability findings.

·       Carryout penetration test report writing and articles on test methodologies.

A Controller Area Network (CAN bus) is a robust vehicle bus standard designed to allow microcontrollers and devices to communicate with each other in applications without a host computer. It is a message-based protocol, designed originally for multiplex electrical wiring within automobiles to save on copper, but is also used in many other contexts.

"CAN Protocol Module Developer" role involved in SW development for customer specific requirements in the relevant work scope along with detailed activities mentioned below.

•Analyze customer requirements or spec proposal
•Software design and implementation for customer project specification
•Interface between customer project, Platform and SW development group
•Integration, test and delivery of CAN network communication related software project development along with planning, coordination and release for series production
•Follow company development and quality processes

Job Description:

A Controller Area Network (CAN bus) is a robust vehicle bus standard designed to allow microcontrollers and devices to communicate with each other in applications without a host computer. It is a message-based protocol, designed originally for multiplex electrical wiring within automobiles to save on copper, but is also used in many other contexts.

"CAN Protocol Module Developer" role involved in SW development for customer specific requirements in the relevant work scope along with detailed activities mentioned below.

•Analyze customer requirements or spec proposal
•Software design and implementation for customer project specification
•Interface between customer project, Platform and SW development group
•Integration, test and delivery of CAN network communication related software project development along with planning, coordination and release for series production
•Follow company development and quality processes
•Investigate for the issues or problem during the project development and after production.
•Department task support / coordination

Security Manager:

 The Security Manager is part of the project team, supporting the creation and maintenance of security-relevant work products and coordinating security process activities within the project.

 The Security Manager may be member of the product development team, nominated by the project leader. In this case, the role may be specifically allocated, or it may be taken as additional role by a competent project member, e.g. the Project Manager or the  System Architect. Job Description:

You will be responsible for integrating software components from various contributors – internal and external to create working subsystems for high compute platforms for Automated Driving. Your key tasks include the following

·       Compile, Package, Verify, Quality Scan, Publish Artifact, Deploy to Development, Integration and Functional Testing

·       You will be responsible for KPIs including code quality metrics, release & delivery process in alignment with architects and process leads

·       Design, develop and maintain maintenance of integration environment and build system infrastructure, Integration tests, Performance tests and regression tests for components and system.

·       Onboard tools from various stages of SW development on to a continuous software delivery pipeline

·       Design, develop and maintain build and integration environment, build system infrastructure and automated test suites

·       Act as first line of defense by troubleshooting build failures, failed test cases, crashes, faults and performance bottlenecks. Debug, analyze and forward bug reports to component responsible with appropriate additional information like stack traces and logs

 

Experiences, competences and core strengths

Must-have

·       Hands on experience in developing software for microcontroller based embedded systems like infotainment, consumer electronics, smartphones, industrial embedded systems or avionics

·       Comprehensive knowledge on phases of Software development life cycle.

·       Hands-On experience in AUTOSAR (Classic and/or Adaptive) with Good understanding of BSW components, RTE, SWCD process, Boot Loader and be well versed with compiler toolchain and build systems. You should be well versed with C and C++programming languages

·       Experience in designing continuous integration pipeline stages including configuration management, build, branching strategy and build automation

·       Knowledge of Operating systems RTOS, Memory Allocation , Core distribution concepts.

·       Hands-on scripting experience with Python, Groovy, Shell, CAPL & Perl

·       Knowledge of state of the art in DevOps including popular tools

·       Functional knowledge of Intel Arch64 and ARM microprocessor architectures. Knowledge of coprocessors and hardware accelerators are also desirable. You should have experience in board bring up and flashing of microprocessor boards

·       You should have sufficient knowhow and experience on test frameworks, testing environments and test automation frameworks

·       You should be comfortable with SW architecture practices as well as working with architecture documentation tools like Enterprise Architect or Rhapsody

Good to have

·       Automotive system knowledge ECU, Sensors and systems will be great

·       Experience or awareness of Adaptive Autosar standard and platform

·       Good knowledge of ASPICE process standard is an added advantage

·       Knowledge of Functional Safety standards and processes like ISO26262 and ASIL

·       Knowledge on integration testing using Robot test framework, ECU Test and/or Vector environments example vFlash, DiVA

·       Hands on Experience or good overview on Dockers, Conan packaging

Optional

It would be great if you have experience in setting up DevOps pipeline components on either on-premise clusters or on any cloud infrastructure

Core strengths

·       Excellent communication and soft skills.

·       Very good at teamwork and problem solving

·       Ability to gel well with Agile teams in real spirit (culture & mindset)

·       Effective collaboration with global software engineering teams

.       Passion to learn new technologies beyond current experience

 

Skillset

1. SW Architecture tools

Enterprise Architect, Rhapsody or equivalent

2. Testing tools and environments

Vector tools and environments like CAPL and CANOE

Test tools like Robot Test Framework

3. DevOps pipeline components

·  Azure DevOps, Jenkins

·  Package management systems like Conan or Artifactory and packaging systems like Debian Packaging, npm or Docker trusted registry

4. Build Environment and tools

·  Build environments like Eclipse CDT or Visual Studio

·  Meta make systems like CMake, Catkin, Bit Bake, OBS etc.

·  Well versed with one or more compiler toolchains like GCC, Clang or QNX toolchain

·  Well versed with MAKE systems like GNU MAKE

·  Good experience in using virtualization environments like Docker, VirtualBox, QEMU, vmware etc.

·  Experience using flashing tools, measurement recording and replay tools

5. Embedded operating systems

·  Knowledge of interfaces and internals of any embedded, embeddable, RTOS like QNX, Linux, Windows Embedded, FreeRTOS or anything similar.

6. Development environments and tools

·  Expertise with popular IDEs like Visual Studio, Eclipse or similar

·  Hands on experience with symbolic debugging with gdb, Visual Studio or Trace32

·  Comfortable in using hardware or or-chip debug interfaces like JTAG, Lauterbach etc.

7. Programming languages

Development experience or proficiency in any high-level programming language:

·  Modern C++ (>11) and C

·  Java, Javascript, C# optionally

8. Scripting languages

Hands on development experience in scripting languages like Shell scripting, Python, Groovy

9. Markup languages for documentation

Knowledge of languages like JSON, XML or YAML

Modern vehicles have a diagnostic interface for off-board diagnostics, which makes it possible to connect a computer (client) or diagnostics tool, which is referred to as tester, to the bus system of the vehicle. Thus, the messages defined in UDS can be sent to the controllers which must provide the predetermined UDS services. This makes it possible to interrogate the fault memory of the individual control units in the vehicle or to update them with a new firmware.

Diagnostics Communication Protocol Module developer role deals with SW development which fits the context mentioned above along with detailed SW development activities mentioned below.

•Analyze customer requirements or spec proposal
•Software design and implementation for customer project specification
•Interface between customer project, Platform and SW development group
•Integration, test and delivery of UDS [Unified Diagnostic Services] based CAN network communication related software project development along with planning, coordination and release for series production
•Follow company development and quality processes
•Investigate for the issues or problem during the project development and after production.
•Department task support / coordination

Skill Set:

•Software designing experience in similar area of automobile industry/institute
•CAN & UDS communication skill
•Knowledge about ISO14229, 14230 and UDS standard network protocols
•C design experience
•Electronic circuit knowledge
•Good documentation/report ability
•Good in MS Office software

Job Description:

We are looking for a talented Senior Azure Cloud Architect to manage our organization’s cloud architecture and position in cloud environments. You will play a strategic role in maintaining all cloud systems including the front-end platforms, servers, storage, and management networks.

The ideal candidate will have a solid understanding of cloud computing and technology systems, as well as experience in designing and developing for the cloud. You should have a positive attitude and excellent communication skills to effectively share your knowledge.

Responsibilities:

  • Create a well-informed cloud strategy and manage the adaption process.
  • Regularly evaluate cloud applications, hardware, and software.
  • Develop and organize cloud systems.
  • Work closely with IT security to comply with the organization's cloud security policies.
  • Respond to technical issues in a professional and timely manner.
  • Offer guidance in infrastructure movement techniques including bulk application transfers into the cloud.
  • Identify the top cloud architecture solutions to successfully meet the strategic needs of the organization.
  • Technically lead & guide a team of Architects & Specialist.

Requirements:

  • 15+ years of overall experience in IT field.
  • 5+ years of experience in designing, using cloud native solutions and supporting IT cloud infrastructure requirements.
  • Certification in Azure Cloud Architect (AZ303/304) is a must. Certification in AZ500 is added advantage.
  • Positive attitude and a strong commitment to delivering quality work.
  • Excellent knowledge of cloud computing technologies and current computing trends.
  • Effective communication skills (written and verbal) to properly articulate complicated cloud reports to management and other IT development teams.

Modern vehicles have a diagnostic interface for off-board diagnostics, which makes it possible to connect a computer (client) or diagnostics tool, which is referred to as tester, to the bus system of the vehicle. Thus, the messages defined in UDS can be sent to the controllers which must provide the predetermined UDS services. This makes it possible to interrogate the fault memory of the individual control units in the vehicle or to update them with a new firmware.

Diagnostics Communication Protocol Module developer role deals with SW development which fits the context mentioned above along with detailed SW development activities mentioned below.

•Analyze customer requirements or spec proposal
•Software design and implementation for customer project specification
•Interface between customer project, Platform and SW development group
•Integration, test and delivery of UDS [Unified Diagnostic Services] based CAN network communication related software project development along with planning, coordination and release for series production
•Follow company development and quality processes
•Investigate for the issues or problem during the project development and after production.
•Department task support / coordination

Skill Set:

•Software designing experience in similar area of automobile industry/institute
•CAN & UDS communication skill
•Knowledge about ISO14229, 14230 and UDS standard network protocols
•C design experience
•Electronic circuit knowledge
•Good documentation/report ability
•Good in MS Office software

Modern vehicles have a diagnostic interface for off-board diagnostics, which makes it possible to connect a computer (client) or diagnostics tool, which is referred to as tester, to the bus system of the vehicle. Thus, the messages defined in UDS can be sent to the controllers which must provide the predetermined UDS services. This makes it possible to interrogate the fault memory of the individual control units in the vehicle or to update them with a new firmware.

Diagnostics Communication Protocol Module developer role deals with SW development which fits the context mentioned above along with detailed SW development activities mentioned below.

•Analyze customer requirements or spec proposal
•Software design and implementation for customer project specification
•Interface between customer project, Platform and SW development group
•Integration, test and delivery of UDS [Unified Diagnostic Services] based CAN network communication related software project development along with planning, coordination and release for series production
•Follow company development and quality processes
•Investigate for the issues or problem during the project development and after production.
•Department task support / coordination

Skill Set:

•Software designing experience in similar area of automobile industry/institute
•CAN & UDS communication skill
•Knowledge about ISO14229, 14230 and UDS standard network protocols
•C design experience
•Electronic circuit knowledge
•Good documentation/report ability
•Good in MS Office software

1. A software architect needs to interact with customer, product managers, and developers in order to envision, model and provide initial models and designs that can be built. This role also may cover the meeting potential or current customers.
  2. A software architect has to constantly review the code to ensure the quality of the design by avoiding complexity, advocating clarity and to do this with the team. This usually requires hands-on work in terms of developing prototypes, contributing code or evaluating technologies.
  3. The role of a software architect includes collaborative working with a degree of humility and providing mentoring as required. Such collaboration also allows the architect to become familiar with the skills and interests in the team and to share their knowledge with the rest of the team. Humility is required to ensure that all the team is listened to, as they may have more specific experience or knowledge for the problem at hand.
  4. A software architect is a guiding star that shows to the business which technologies it should be using and what new technologies it should be considering, and why.

The Software Architect role translates the requirements allocated to software into a software architecture, whether it is a standard automotive architecture like AUTOSAR or not, the Software Architect define the configurations, interfaces, services and software design rules.

Software Architect owns the static and dynamic architecture definition, documentation and implementation. The Software Architecture has to be developed as per the ASPICE Level 3 Standards.

SW Architect should guide the SW team to develop SW requirement from System requirement task.

 

Responsibilities:

Define, document and implement product Software Architecture.

Discuss and define with stakeholder’s required Software building blocks, i.e. Vector AUTOSAR, Green Hills, etc.

Define third party SW building block integration into the architecture and define SW interfaces.

Static and Dynamic SW architecture definition, documentation and implementation.

Maximize reusability, coherence & cohesion of software components.

Define efficient and effective communication interfaces between software components.

Provide the framework and blueprints to software team to implement features in an organized, defined, clean and efficient embedded SW environment.

Coordinate technically complex issues resolutions between multiple stake holders.

Enforce adherence to the architecture, coding standards and best industry SW designs standards.

Software Architect works closely with System Team to define and document Software Requirements.

Define and negotiate application layer modules interfaces to maximize reusability and execution efficiency. 

Define & document internal communication between microcontrollers in the same board.

Coordinate complex issues root cause analysis and resolution with Software module owners.

Primary technical contact for customer and other competencies technical issues, real time interaction, consultation and technical guidance to less experienced developers.

Modern vehicles have a diagnostic interface for off-board diagnostics, which makes it possible to connect a computer (client) or diagnostics tool, which is referred to as tester, to the bus system of the vehicle. Thus, the messages defined in UDS can be sent to the controllers which must provide the predetermined UDS services. This makes it possible to interrogate the fault memory of the individual control units in the vehicle or to update them with a new firmware.

Diagnostics Communication Protocol Module developer role deals with SW development which fits the context mentioned above along with detailed SW development activities mentioned below.

•Analyze customer requirements or spec proposal
•Software design and implementation for customer project specification
•Interface between customer project, Platform and SW development group
•Integration, test and delivery of UDS [Unified Diagnostic Services] based CAN network communication related software project development along with planning, coordination and release for series production
•Follow company development and quality processes
•Investigate for the issues or problem during the project development and after production.
•Department task support / coordination

Skill Set:

•Software designing experience in similar area of automobile industry/institute
•CAN & UDS communication skill
•Knowledge about ISO14229, 14230 and UDS standard network protocols
•C design experience
•Electronic circuit knowledge
•Good documentation/report ability
•Good in MS Office software

Product Owner Opportunity @ MS/ESH

Job Description

Candidate Characteristics

·        Formulate strategy/approach to guide Teams’ achievement of their target outcomes (Predictability, Quality, Efficiency) through application of agile methods

·        Flexibility in wearing different hats such as a Servant Leader, Coach, Facilitator, Mentor, and Change agent

·        Provide thought leadership and aid management in designing/enabling the underlying system to support application & sustenance of agile practices and culture 

·        Facilitate identification and removal of systemic impediments for adoption of agile methods

·        Familiar with a wide-range of Lean-Agile methodologies, Scaling frameworks and practices

·        Ability to apply the most fitting methodologies to different challenges such as combined software and system development

·        Strong ability to work in a team (Empathetic, adaptive, and positive mind-set)

·        Business-minded, performance-driven, results-oriented, conflict resolution skills

Tactical/Operational:

  • Serve as the voice of the client.

• Work for new generation braking system on specific products in Active safety - ESP, iBooster, new upcoming products

Should be able to perform the following:
1. To design and write the embedded software as per the requirements of the client
2. If the existing system needs to changed, then they are responsible for interpreting the requirements and changes that are needed in the software and develop specifications and discuss it with the seniors
3. To review the implemented system, understand and interpret the error reports from internal staff and external clients, troubleshoot and debug them in the embedded environment and provide instant fixtures for the same
4. To maintain and document the software programs and resolutions given for the technical issues and any other relevant data that may be of importance
5. To interact effectively with the team members and contribute in increasing their knowledge and understanding their problems
6. To work in close association with the clients to understand their needs and to address the issues related to the process

Job Description:

You will be responsible for integrating application software components from various contributors – internal and external to create working Complete SW (CSW) subsystems for high compute platforms for Automated Driving. Your key tasks include the following

·       Compile, Package, Verify, Quality Scan, Publish Artifact, Deploy to Development, Integration and Functional Testing

·       You will be responsible for KPIs including code quality metrics, release & delivery process in alignment with architects and process leads

·       Design, develop and maintain maintenance of integration environment, build system infrastructure, Integration tests, Performance tests and regression tests for components and system.

·       Onboard tools from various stages of SW development on to a continuous software delivery pipeline

Act as first line of defense by troubleshooting build failures, failed test cases, crashes, faults and performance bottlenecks. Debug, analyze and forward bug reports to component responsible with appropriate additional information like stack traces and logs

 

Experiences, competences and core strengths

Must-have

·       Hands on experience in integrating software for microcontroller & microprocessor based embedded systems

·       Deep knowledge of vehicle networking & strong experience in distributed embedded systems.

·       Hands on experience in developing system testing and maintaining system test environments

·       Comprehensive knowledge on phases of Software development life cycle.

·       Hands-On experience in AUTOSAR (Classic and/or Adaptive) with Good understanding of BSW components, RTE, SWCD process, Boot Loader and be well versed with compiler toolchain and build systems. You should be well versed with C and C++programming languages

·       Hands-on development experience in embedded systems using Linux, QNX, FreeRTOS or similar and be well versed with compiler toolchain and build systems (Make / Cmake know how). You should be well versed with C and C++programming languages

·       Experience in designing continuous integration pipeline stages including configuration management, build, branching strategy and build automation

·       Excellent communication, organization, and coordination skills with Proven ability to work under firm deadlines in a fast-paced environment

·       Hands-on scripting experience with Python, Groovy, Shell, CAPL & Perl

·       Knowledge of state of the art in DevOps including popular tools

·       Functional knowledge of Intel Arch64 and ARM microprocessor architectures. Knowledge of coprocessors and hardware accelerators are also desirable. You should have experience in board bring up and flashing of microprocessor and microcontroller boards

·       You should have sufficient knowhow and experience on test frameworks, testing environments and test automation frameworks

·       You should be comfortable with SW architecture practices as well as working with architecture documentation tools like Enterprise Architect or Rhapsody

Good to have

·       Automotive system knowledge ECU, Sensors and systems will be great

·       Experience or awareness of Adaptive Autosar standard and platform

·       Good knowledge of ASPICE process standard is an added advantage

·       Knowledge of Functional Safety standards and processes like ISO26262 and ASIL

·       Knowledge on packaging tools like Conan

·       Overview on variant handling

·       Knowledge of FMEA

Optional

·       It would be great if you have experience in setting up DevOps pipeline components on either on-premise clusters or on any cloud infrastructure

Core strengths

·       Excellent communication and soft skills.

·       Very good at teamwork, decision making and problem solving

·       Ability to gel well with Agile teams in real spirit (culture & mindset)

·       Effective collaboration with global software engineering teams

·       Passion to learn new technologies beyond current experience

The Verification & Validation (VnV) Manager is responsible for leading and driving the overall vision for the V&V, ensuring high quality SW is delivered to Customer. He/She represents the V&V domain during internal or external stakeholder interactions

Responsible for

- Managing Quality, Cost and Delivery of V&V Activities

Authority for

  • performs risk management (Identification, assessment, actions definition and tracking)

  • represent VnV in Meetings like System Engineering, Engg Project Review, Customer Project Review, PCR meetings
  • manages test infrastructure across features in the project (e.g., sharing of HIL systems)
  • participates in ITCB meetings before every release for test scope finalization
  • performs resource planning & utilization
  • tracks the project budget utilization
  • performs project-specific purchases activities for setting up of test infrastructure (HILs, SW licenses etc.)

The UX Lead designer is responsible for a holistic, multidisciplinary approach to
design user interfaces for In-Vehicle Infotainment system, defining their form,
behavior, content and their realization in design tools.


The Usability Lead Designer (UX) works within global, cross-functional product
development teams to optimize the design of hardware, software, and services
solutions by applying deep domain expertise in design theory and techniques,
and an awareness of user needs derived through formal research. The resultant
product solutions must satisfy both the functional and emotional needs of
internal and external stakeholders, and improve quality, cost, and access
metrics associated with infotainment system development.

Key responsibilities include:

  • Manage & support the UX Designers in meeting the deliverables on time
  • Participates actively in user research and usability testing activities in
  • collaboration with the user research team.
  • Conduct user requirements analysis, task analysis, conceptual modeling,
  • information architecture design, and interaction design.
  • Effectively communicate research findings, conceptual ideas, detailed
  • design, and design rationale both verbally and visually.
  • Define the workflow and highlight the true nature of the underlying
  • problems, and propose creative solutions, which can be validated by end
  • users.
  • Design of screen layouts, typographic expression, icons and other basic
  • UI graphical resources elements to support identification of actions,
  • objects, status information and UI properties.
  • Design and specify user interfaces and information architecture using
  • participatory and iterative design techniques, including observational
  • studies, customer interviews, usability testing, and other forms of
  • requirements discovery.
  • Produce user requirements specifications, personas, storyboards,
  • scenarios, flowcharts, design prototypes, and design specifications.

Mandatory Skills:

  • Strong knowledge of interaction design processes and methodology,
  • particularly as applied to software applications or consumer electronics
  • products.
  • Familiarity with user centered research methods like usability testing,
  • contextual inquiry, and field interviews.
  • Proficiency with design and prototyping using various tools.
  • Excellent knowledge of standard graphic design software tools. (e.g.
  • Photoshop, Illustrator, Flash, Microsoft Visio, etc).
  • A passion for creating products that resonate emotionally with people.
  • Strong communications (written and verbal), and problem solving skills.
  • Must be able to work in a team and independently.
  • Ability to take critiques with a positive attitude.
  • Effectively communicate conceptual ideas, detailed design, and design
  • rationale both verbally and visually.

Desirable Skills:

  • Ability to rapidly sketch/prototype ideas in various digital media
  • Multi-tasking in projects with good knowledge of time-management
  • Strong team orientation
  • Experience in Automotive domain is preferred

Seeking a cybersecurity Expert for Driver Assistance Electronic control Unit Based on Ultrasonic sensor and Near range Cameras. The cyber security Expert will design security solutions and support system engineers to develop secure connectivity solutions.

 

 

Ø  Responsible for developing  cutting edge  Automotive cybersecurity solution such as Trusted boot, Secure communication ,Secure logging, Secure coding, Ethernet Security (e.g. SecOC , TLS), SOTA/FOTA - Software/Firmware Over the Air, Fuzz testing.

Ø  Discuss and review all customer security requirements and propose solutions  and ensure that Bosch product satisfies all security requirements

Ø  Application and Configuration of Hardware Trust Anchors and Crypto Stack/libraries

Ø  Develop the Security architecture (system and Software level) along with project architects, Develop Security Concept, identify the gap between Customer Security Requirements & Security platform and perform TARA to identify the remaining residual risk in customer project.

Ø  To Identify, plan, establish, coordinate and monitor the security activities identified in the process throughout the product development life cycle.

Ø  Provide technical support to development team, collaborate on incident response and customer complaints related to security issues.

Ø  Beyond the scope of product engineering, consider the impacts on production and In-Field Use Cases, e.g : return analysis.

Engineering Product Quality (EPQ)  is responsible for process and quality assurance of a project./Product.

Responsibilities include and not restricted to:

  • Determination of quality strategy for the product.
  • Creation and regular updating of product-related quality forecast (quality preview) and alignment of quality targets with product/project and business targets) with risk assessments and if necessary arrange measures and review their effectiveness.
  • Independent evaluation of product-/process maturity (e.g.: reviews, PMAP, assessments (for example ASPICE, CMMI)...) and early escalation of risks in Q-organization.
  • Alignment of Q-targets for products/projects with superior targets (e.g. GB, area, customer) and reporting to the defined superior level of the product/project as well as the superior  Q-function.
  • Preparation of quality report based on defined quality targets and KPI (e.g. SLA-Compliance).
  • Duty to escalate if measures to achieve the Q-targets are not sufficient in her/his view.
  • Release of SW-Release (e.g. for sample delivery, field tests) of in-house development and third-party components (external procurement, customer provision, OSS) from Q-perspective.
  • Request systematical problem solving in case of deviations in the project
  • Support of Project Manager regarding communication of quality relevant aspects to customers.
  • Ensurance of Lessons Learned of previous projects and similar products
  • Active support in planning and performing of Quality Gates (participant in QG) and critical view on QG assessment.
  • Ensurance and participation in Lessons Learned Workshops for project completion.
  • Verification, if software quality assurance activities (including reviews of software artifacts and security tests) are carried out as planned and whether the quality status corresponds to the prerequisites for the product release.

Job Responsibilities :

- Requirement Analysis/Definition : Analyse Customer/ System Requirement and define SW requirements.

- Development/Integration/Testing : Implement and configure software according to requirements. Develop SW level testcases.

The Software Architect role translates the requirements allocated to software into a software architecture, whether it is a standard automotive architecture like AUTOSAR or not, the Software Architect define the configurations, interfaces, services and software design rules.

Software Architect owns the static and dynamic architecture definition, documentation and implementation. The Software Architecture has to be developed as per the ASPICE Level 3 Standards.

SW Architect should guide the SW team to develop SW requirement from System requirement task.

 

Responsibilities:

Define, document and implement product Software Architecture.

Discuss and define with stakeholder’s required Software building blocks, i.e. Vector AUTOSAR, Green Hills, etc.

Define third party SW building block integration into the architecture and define SW interfaces.

Static and Dynamic SW architecture definition, documentation and implementation.

Maximize reusability, coherence & cohesion of software components.

Define efficient and effective communication interfaces between software components.

Software Architect works closely with System Team to define and document Software Requirements.

Primary technical contact for customer and other competencies technical issues, real time interaction, consultation and technical guidance to less experienced developers.

1) Pre Acquisition Phase: Coordinate with PjM & TPM and understand customer requirements (study customer drawings), identify standard Bosch library product to satisfy customer requirement / deisgn, raise a design order for creation of drawing, responsible for preparation of EVOB document based on the received drawing, feed technical details related to project (sensor), coordiante with production team, PPC team and CTG team for inputs related to costs enquiry, receive per piece cost from CTG and feed the same in iGPM (Integrated Global Process Management) tool in Quo Module


2) Technical Presentation for Review: After the award of business, preare technical presentation (possible offerings) for customer review meeting, provide technical offerings to customer and negotiate with customer related to offerings, prepare project timeline & milestones with PjM and share with customer for approval


3) Air Gap Analysis & Design Assessment: Coordinate with customer for Tonner Ring avalability, shipping of Tonner Ring to Bosch Germany, raise a test order for Air Gap Analysis and share the reports with customer and design team (India), conduct design assessment meeting (Germany) for freezing Base Type


4) Project Kick Off: Conduct internal project kick off with all stakeholders (China, Japan, Germany, India), conduct tooling kick off for soft tooling / hard tooling readiness


5) Project Execution: Initiate cable sourcing activity with PPC, coordinate with tooling team (China) for availability of tooling readiness and release, coordinate with CFT and perform all QG assesment using QAT (Quality Assessment Tool) in MCR (Management of Cost and Resources), coordinate with manufacturing team (China / Chakan) for sample (C&D) availability, carry out installation review at customer end on C sample, raise a requisition to Engineering department in Germany for PVT (Product Validation Test) & DVT (Design Validation Test) testing, share the outcomes of the tests with customers and get drawing and TCD release sign off


6) Technical Customer Documentation: Creation of the technical customer documentation (TCD) and other project documents after project award and bring to an agreement internally as well as with the customer (TCD release sign off)


7) Project Review: Issue, update and track project time schedules, coordinate internally and with customer for on time project delivery, follow up for sub suppliers, PPAP for production release, track project targets (development cost, PHEK and change cost), technical requirements and escalate to management level if necessary


8) WSS Change Over Manager for IN region: Gather VPZ/TPZ information from Sales / PjM / Manufacturing team for all WSS projects, update VPZ/TPZ data in to WSS Change Over List, attend Bi-Weekly meeting with all stakeholders for explaining current project status for IN region
9) Budget Planning: Coordinate with EVA team members to prepare the budget for EVA department, identify revenue / capital purchase items, coordiante with team and suppliers for quotations and technical discussion, coordinate wtih PIR for purchase through PR, tracking of PR / PO for delivery of items, support for custom clearance for imported items


10) Audits: Ensure compliance to customer audits, external & internal audits, process & system audits, CAU / AUD audits, TS, Quality & HSE audits.


11) Responsible for maintaining 5S, health, safety and quality compliance

We are seeking highly creative & motivated researches to develop new algorithms and supporting frameworks in the area of computer vision for various applications, mainly autonomous driving. The topics covered include development of technology assets that are important in the computer vision data loop such as search and retrieval, smart data selection, incremental learning, domain adaptation between different types of cameras etc. You will work as part of a talented research team, supported by a software engineering team. You'll be among the first to see and use this technology to solve real problems in ways never attempted by others.

About Us

We are looking for Product Owners who have potential to become future Digital

Transformation leaders with a capability to digitally enrich our Mobility solutions and open

a world of new possibilities to push the boundaries of mobility. If you are a leader, led

teams in developing new, profitable million dollar revenue streams and opening new

business opportunities for your organization, have a strong understanding of People,

Process & Technology and have agility to build a startup ecosystem in a large enterprise

setup, please read the description below.

About the role

Connected mobility has turned in from science fiction to reality. We are opening a whole

new breath of possibilities to push the boundaries of mobility into a new dimension all

together with the help of IOT, Advance Deep Learning Technologies & Systems Thinking.

We solve real world problems which mean to our planet. Either it is about Improve

Air Quality of this planet with the help of Deep learning, Building Connected

parking solutions with the help of IOT, Electrification to Fuel cell technology or

Building Driverless Cars, by being a neutral player we have made our subtle presence

in every second vehicle in this world and reimagined the way our planet can become

sustainable, to know more about our mobility solutions. please click here to know

more about Connected Mobility

Bosch Limited is a flagship company of Robert Bosch Group, one of the world's leading

global supplier of technology and services, offering end-to-end Engineering,

Technology and Business Solutions. Connected Mobility Solutions is one amongst

many of the multiple Solution Offerings.

As a Product Owner (PO) you will be a member of the Agile Team representing

customer and working closely with the Product management. You will be responsible

for defining Stories and prioritizing the Team Backlog to streamline the execution of

program priorities while maintaining the conceptual and technical integrity of the

Features or components for the team. You will own the team backlogs, drive the

iterations, accepts iteration increments and contributes to vision, roadmap and ROI.

Roles & Responsibilities

Product owners play a pivotal role in product development. Their focus lies in the

iteration area of implementation versus setting the strategy or defining the key

deliverables. A product owner’s focus stays with the specific solution, underlying and

supporting technologies, and the implementation team(s) they’re working with.

 Program Increment (PI) Planning –

o PO is heavily involved in program backlog refinement and preparation for PI

planning and plays a significant role in the planning event.

o PO updates the team backlog and typically reviews and contributes to the program

vision, Roadmap, and content presentations

o PO is involved in story definition, providing the clarifications necessary to assist the

team with their story estimates and sequencing.

o The entire Agile team, which includes the PO, also work together to determine their

team PI objectives for the upcoming PI.

 Iteration Execution

o Maintaining the team backlog – With input from System Architect/Engineering and

other stakeholders, the PO has the primary responsibility for building, editing, and

maintaining the team backlog. Consisting mostly of user stories, it also includes

defects and enablers.

o Iteration Planning – The PO reviews and reprioritizes the backlog as part of the

preparation work for Iteration Planning, including coordination of dependencies with

other PO. During the iteration planning event, the PO communicates story detail and

priorities and ensures the team aligns and agrees on a final iteration plan.

o Apply Behavior-Driven Development (BDD) – POs collaborate with their team to

detail stories with acceptance criteria and examples in the form of acceptance tests

o Accepting stories – The PO works with the team to agree on accepted story

completion. This includes validating that the story meets acceptance criteria, that it

has the appropriate, persistent acceptance tests, and that it otherwise complies with

its Definition of Done (DoD). In so doing, the PO also assures a level of quality,

focusing primarily on fitness for use

o Understand enabler work - While POs are not expected to drive technological

decisions, they are supposed to understand the scope of the upcoming enabler work

and collaborate with System and Solution Architects/Engineering to assist with

decision-making and sequencing of the critical technological infrastructures that will

host the new business functionality

o Participate in team demo and retrospective – collaborate with their team and any

other stakeholders in the team demo. They also participate in the Iteration

Retrospective, where the teams gather to improve their processes and are active in

the Agile Release Train’s (ART’s) Inspect and Adapt (I&A) workshop

 Program Execution:

o During each PI, the PO coordinates dependencies with other POs. The PO also has

an instrumental role in producing the System Demo for program and Value Stream

stakeholders.

 Inspect and Adapt:

o PO works across teams to define and implement improvement stories that will

increase the velocity and quality of the program.

o PO has an instrumental role in producing the PI system demo for program

stakeholders.

incubation in your experience.

$5M - $50 and revenue growth in your previous experience.

Job Description

Analyze and refine requirements for delivering the necessary technology service to business The Business Process Expert will work closely with the business and solution teams to translate business requirements and user stories into high quality functional design documents that can be delivered by the solution teams to ensure the best user experience possible for customers.

Develop project rationale and perform scoping assessments to determine feasibility of projects Highlight/identify gaps in existing functionality and review requirements with stakeholders Develop a comprehensive requirement specifications that will determine the estimate of cost, time and resources to deploy solutions Liaise with the service development team to suggest a high level functional solution Develop project estimates and complete financial model (costs, savings, revenue opportunities, investment horizon, etc.) 

Ensure that relevant stakeholders are involved in specification of new services and/or major upgrades to existing services Perform in a functional expert role to the Agile teams continuing success and improvement, by leading/participating Agile ceremonies as required and delivering assigned artifacts Work with business stakeholders to gather and prioritize business and functional requirements through Backlog Grooming and Sprint Planning sessions Develop user stories that satisfy business requirements while providing the best user experience possible, including appropriate acceptance criteria and testing requirements Conduct Sprint Demos with business stakeholders to ensure developed solutions satisfy the business requirements.

Provide feedback to development team members as necessary Support QA testing process to minimize defects Deliver necessary artifacts to support deployment timelines Actively participate in Sprint Retrospective sessions to identify and initiate process improvements (continuous improvement) Work with Production Support team in the research and resolution of production issues.

Minimum requirements Bachelor Degree in Computer Science, MIS or Business Administration or a related field The ability to fluently read, write, understand and communicate in English. 

1.    8 years of applicable experience 
2.    Minimum 4 years experience in SAP Hybris Commerce (preferably B2B or B2B2C)
3.    Extensive knowledge in B2B and B2C business.
4.    Total 5 years of experience in cloud-based eCommerce systems 
5.     Experience with Atlassian toolsets (JIRA, Confluence)
6.    Provide in depth knowledge of Hybris platform and its various products.
7.    Articulate complex problems narrated vaguely into precise business requirements & technical specifications.
8.    To work through the entire life cycle of a project from inception to implementation.
9.    Collaborate with business units to identify/frame out meaningful data analysis (Customer, product, pricing, associate data sets).
10.    Stay up to date with best practices and innovation initiatives in the e-commerce / multichannel environment.

Profile Summary:

System Architect is responsible for System Architecture concepts, Design & Development   for In-Vehicle-Infotainment systems.

Desired Skills:

  • Prior experience in System Architecture related to Automotive Embedded product/s. Overall work experience of 10-14 years of industry experience.
  • Clarification of technical requirements with the customer and the components of In-Vehicle-Infotainment system (SW, HW, Algorithm)
  • System Requirements Engineering and Requirements Management
  • Definition of the customer projects system architecture, using the platform system architecture as a starting point
  • Creation of the system FMEA
  • Experienced in decomposition of requirements and partitioning large systems into subsystems and components.
  • Knowledge of tools as IBM Doors, ClearCase, UML modeling, Enterprise Architect tools.
  • Knowledge of embedded operating systems (e.g. Greenhills, Linux, Android) & programming
  • Experienced in analyzing the system level issues using performance tools and defining startup order of the drivers/process of In-Vehicle-Infotainment systems.
  • Experience in embedded C/C++ & Good knowledge of Linux kernel space programming
  • Expertise in systemD services, Dbus, CCA & ASF frameworks
  • Good understanding of Layered SW architecture and Linux internals
  • Hands on experience on Android and Linux platforms
  • Excellent Analytical & Debugging skills
  • Experienced in Performing cost–benefit analyses
  • Strong communication and interpersonal skills

Development / customization and delivery, V&V.

  • Communication - Develop and manage projects status, project reviews and other communication tools as needed

About Us

We are looking for Product Managers who have potential to become future Digital

Transformation leaders with a capability to digitally enrich our Mobility solutions and open

a world of new possibilities to push the boundaries of mobility. If you are a leader, led

teams in developing new, profitable million dollar revenue streams and opening new

business opportunities for your organization, have a strong understanding of People,

Process & Technology and have agility to build a startup ecosystem in a large enterprise

setup, please read the description below.

About the role

Connected mobility has turned in from science fiction to reality. We are opening a whole

new breath of possibilities to push the boundaries of mobility into a new dimension all

together with the help of IOT, Advance Deep Learning Technologies & Systems Thinking.

We solve real world problems which mean to our planet. Either it is about Improve

Air Quality of this planet with the help of Deep learning, Building Connected

parking solutions with the help of IOT, Electrification to Fuel cell technology or

Building Driverless Cars, by being a neutral player we have made our subtle presence

in every second vehicle in this world and reimagined the way our planet can become

sustainable, to know more about our mobility solutions. please click here to know

more about Connected Mobility

Bosch Limited is a flagship company of Robert Bosch Group, one of the world's leading

global supplier of technology and services, offering end-to-end Engineering,

Technology and Business Solutions. Connected Mobility Solutions is one amongst

many of the multiple Solution Offerings.

As Product manager you will be responsible for understanding customer needs, shape

the technology vision, own the execution and delivery of the products. Product

managers are expected to collaborate with a wide range of people to identify and define

customer needs, understand the Solution Context, and develop the Program Vision,

Roadmap, and Features required to meet these needs. Have a customer centric

mindset.

Roles & Responsibilities

 Meet business goals – Products and solutions must meet the economic business goals

established by the portfolio

 Get it built – Product Managers collaborate with lean agile teams to build the required

functionality through a continuous delivery pipeline

 Get it off the shelf – Internally, Product Managers collaborate with IT to ensure solutions

are deployed to internal customers and users; externally, Product Managers collaborate

with an even larger set of business stakeholders to deliver products to the market

 Leverage support – Product Managers ensure their offerings are supported and

enhanced by various business functions to create a continuous flow of value

In addition, Product managers are expected to manage the Product Lifecycle and

Technology Adoption Curve

Job Description:

A Controller Area Network (CAN bus) is a robust vehicle bus standard designed to allow microcontrollers and devices to communicate with each other in applications without a host computer. It is a message-based protocol, designed originally for multiplex electrical wiring within automobiles to save on copper, but is also used in many other contexts.

"CAN Protocol Module Developer" role involved in SW development for customer specific requirements in the relevant work scope along with detailed activities mentioned below.

•Analyze customer requirements or spec proposal
•Software design and implementation for customer project specification
•Interface between customer project, Platform and SW development group
•Integration, test and delivery of CAN network communication related software project development along with planning, coordination and release for series production
•Follow company development and quality processes
•Investigate for the issues or problem during the project development and after production.
•Department task support / coordination

•Software designing experience in similar area of automobile industry/institute
•CAN communication skill
•Knowledge about ISO14229 or 14230 standard network protocols
•C design experience
•Electronic circuit knowledge
•Good documentation/report ability
•Good in MS Office software
